meanings.definition: Comparative form of shout, meaning louder in volume.
meanings.sent1: The lion's roar was much shoutier than the bird's chirp.
meanings.sent2: The concert got even shoutier when the band played their hit song.
meanings.sent3: The shoutier the thunder, the more scared the cat became.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a shoutier version of a giggle.
meanings.sent5: The shoutier the alarm, the faster people woke up.

meanings.definition: Someone who shouts frequently or loudly.
meanings.sent1: The shoutier in the crowd was heard above everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the shoutier to lower their voice in the library.
meanings.sent3: The shoutier at the game made sure everyone knew his team was winning.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the shoutier of the family, always making her opinions heard.
meanings.sent5: The shoutier's voice echoed through the empty hallways.
